intro: Psychotria ianthina, commonly known as the purple psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Psychotria ianthina is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the ecological interactions of its native habitat.
